body.name: Royal Spy Institute 1: The Crown Heist (A Young Adult Fantasy)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Crown Heist
reviews.reviewText: Thirteen year-old Heather the Mouse is the MC & she received that title because she is a very gifted thief. She is in a street gang called Jace’s Menagerie run by her uncle Jace. While out on a “job”, Mouse is double crossed by her 2 adult partners after her efforts to steal a very valuable magic necklace. They take the necklace & leave her to be arrested after she is immobilized with a spell after unlocking the jewelry case. After being locked in her cell for several hours, she has a visit from the Headmaster of RSI, the Radcliffe-Stone Institute for Troubled Youth with an offer for her to enroll at their school or stay in jail to face the consequences of her attempted thievery. She decides to go to RSI not understanding what the school is actually training her to become. This is was an interesting, enjoyable read for me. I plan to read book 2.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So much fun
reviews.reviewText: I got hooked reading the gryphon rider series and am so pleased to continue to this one. I can't help but be charmed by Chance as he joins Heather on her adventures and trials learning how to fit in, find herself and save the day with the help of her new friends.I love a book that just warms your heart all the way through.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Top notch YA fantasy
reviews.reviewText: Definitely one of the better written YA fantasy novels that I have read for a while. Engaging main characters, over the top but not overwhelming plot, worth the read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book was so awesome. I will be glad when the next one comes out. I will definitely read it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fun And Fast-paced!
reviews.reviewText: I'll admit, when I first started this book I was thrown by how young the fmc was. From the blurb and the cover I had assumed she would be in her older teens, not younger teens. However, I did still enjoy the story. There was enough humor, twists, interesting side characters, and a fast paced plot to keep me engaged. I still would've preferred to have an older fmc, plot wise I think there could've been more directions to go in had she been older. But it worked at the age the fmc was given, it just took me longer to connect to her character. Overall, I did enjoy the book. And I wouldn't be opposed to reading a sequel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book was the perfect start to what seems to be another amazing series! I love how it's in the same world as Gryphon Rider Academy, and we get to see a glimpse of our favorite MFC from that series. I can't wait for more adventures in the next installment!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I loved this series starter! The storyline was fun, and the characters were great. I enjoyed little plugs from past series as well. I’m excited for the next one!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: When it comes to "epic" fantasies, many authors makes the story unnecessarily long just to have more than one or two books. This author did not. It was easy to be invested in the characters and it was nice how it tied into the overall Gryphon Rider series. The one thing I had an issue with really was the cover. The image of the girl appears to be early twenties while the protagonist is thirteen. It threw me off at the beginning but that aside, thoroughly enjoyed this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I picked this up because I liked the sound of the story. From page one I was pulled in as Mouse attempted a heist that was only going to go wrong. Hennessy has a way of drawing out the world and making you feel as if you’re completely immersed in it. I loved the characters, the twists and turns, and the way the story just spoke to me and made me feel like I was watching it play out in front of me. It’s a series that I will be continuing and a great story that is well written and expertly engaging. Very much recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have thoroughly enjoyed this book, and I recommend it to all. You can expect a story well written, with well-rounded characters each bringing their own identity to the tale.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: essentially book 3.5 in the gryphon rider series
reviews.reviewText: This is best read before gryphon rider book 4 as there is some interaction introducing characters and set in the capital city of the country that the gryphon riders serve.
